description.narrative: 5.4: The MOSD, at all levels, leads, manages and implements a comprehensive and integrated social protection system., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome: Strengthened child and gender sensitive social protection systems for vulnerable children and their families

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
Shock responsive social protection - Strengthening social protection system for humanitarian response (preparedness)
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social welfare workforce strengthening - Case management, referral, capacity development

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration

title.narrative: Lesotho United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Lesotho 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 5.4: The MOSD, at all levels, leads, manages and implements a comprehensive and integrated social protection system.

description.narrative: The Ministry of Social Development (MoSD) has established 10 Social Protection Committees subnational level; and expanded the Integrated Social Safety Nets (ISSNs) to 22 councils as part of strengthening social protection coordination mechanism. | Status:Met | As-of Date:07/12/2018

title.narrative: Number of community councils that include 3 social safety nets in an integrated system
2.4 Coordination: Coordination mechanisms for social protection systems established countrywide

baseline.value: Approved Social Protection Coordination Framework and 3 committee at national level established

target.value: 2018:Coordination meeting takes place at national level and 10 district SP committee established
